prompt.p: Anaemia is a reduction in red cell haemoglobin concentration relative to that found in a population of similar age and sex. Anaemias usually have an underlying cause.
What type of anaemia is associated with renal failure?

modalFeedback.p: Option E (Normocytic anaemia) is Correct. Normocytic anaemia is associated with renal failure.

modalFeedback.p:
Table 12.6 Causes of different forms of anaemia according to red cell volume.
Taken from: Naish et al: Basic Medical Sciences 1E
Option A (Haemolytic anaemia) is Incorrect. Haemolytic anaemia is usually autoimmune in origin.
Option B (Macrocytic anaemic with megaloblastic marrow) is Incorrect. Macrocytic anaemic with megaloblastic marrow is caused by a deficiency of vitamin B 12 or folic acid.
Option C (Macrocytic anaemia with normoblastic marrow) is Incorrect. Macrocytic anaemia with normoblastic marrow is caused by myelodysplasia or alcohol.
Option D (Microcytic anaemia) is Incorrect. Microcytic anaemia is caused by iron deficiency or thalassaemia.
Option E (Normocytic anaemia) is Correct. Normocytic anaemia is associated with renal failure.
